questions.question: Have you ever experenced lucid dreaming? Do you have or know a practice that can cause lucid dreaming? If you could lucid dream, what would you do in your dream?

It has been said that the term "bisexual" is insensitive because it implies that "there are only two genders". With more and more people exploring their gender identities and concluding that they don't fit into either male or female, it is said that the term "pansexual" is preferred for people sexually attracted to "all" (previously "both") genders. What are your thoughts?
Who do you sometimes compare yourself to?
Can you think of something that everyone could agree on, despite the chaotic world we live in?
Not counting your religion, which religions do you find interesting? Why?

What do you think about social media algorithms on platforms like Facebook and Twitter that suggest connections with “like-minded” people (with the same opinions, political views, interests) and allow people they disagree with to be blocked?
Is current religion serving its purpose?
What single thing would you like to make absolutely certain you do (if at all possible) during your lifetime?
How do you understand the terms "self realisation" or "self actualisation"?
Do you believe in God, gods or any supernatural beings? How does your belief or lack of it affect your life?
Who is the spiritual leader you most admire?
Where does your self-worth come from?
Do you believe in Karma? That is, your intentional actions rebound to you either in this life or a future life?

Has anyone tried mushrooms or other hallucinogenics to enter a trance state/get high/to feel calm..or to achieve "enlightenment"?
What do guys think about it..one should do it or not?
Are you superstitious? If so in what ways? Do you observe any superstitions even though you don’t believe in them like saying “bless you” when someone sneezes?
Why do we dream?
How do you cope with meditation or yoga in a noisy place?
Some people separate the spiritual and sexual aspects of their lives. For others, sex and sexuality are integral to their spirituality. Where are you on this spectrum?
How do you think a person can keep from becoming a workaholic?
How would you describe meditation to someone who doesn’t know anything about it?
What is the greatest quality humans possess?
Why are religious discussions so polarizing at times?
What should be humanity’s goal?
What do you think about aromatherapy? Have you tried it? Any success?

Antinous was the lover of the Roman Emperor Hadrian. He tragically drowned in the Nile when not yet 20. He was praised for his beauty and numerous statues and even temples where built to him. It seems that in the Roman world, men were praised for their beauty more than women.
Why do you think this changed? Do you feel comfortable calling a man "beautiful"? Do you think that men are in fact generally more beautiful than women and that it has nothing to do with your sexuality? Is the fact that in many species of animal, the males are more attractive than the females relevant?
Can meditation give you magical, paranormal or supernatural abilities?

Do you ever wear Pride clothes or clothes with a rainbow, a gay pride patch or badge etc. in public at a non-pride event, like in a shopping mall or at work? Does it change the way you feel or behave? Do you think it changes the way other (straight) people behave towards you?
What does it mean to live in the present moment?
Do you ever experience sexual arousal during meditation or yoga even though you are not seeing or thinking anything sexual? Do you find it distracting? To what do you attribute it?
Have you ever decided not to buy something because of the country in which it was manufactured? Do you consider issues of ethical manufacture when deciding on a purchase?

You often hear the phrase “body and soul” but gay poet Walt Whitman in his poem “I Sing the Body Electric” defined the soul as the body. What do you think about terms like ”body” versus “soul” and “spirit”? How does the body and the individual aspects of our embodiment; our race, gender, sexuality, age, personality, health, intelligence, ability etc. relate to spirituality? Is spirituality even an appropriate word?
What harsh truths do you prefer to ignore?
What is the relationship between science and religion?

“I can meditate for a long time even though I am very tired as long as my mind is clear of thoughts. As soon as I start thinking about something, I fall asleep.”
Do you experience this? How do you explain it? Isn’t it the opposite of what you might expect?

In many places there has been a decline in the number of venues like pubs, clubs and gyms exclusively for gay and lesbian people, often replaced by venues that are explicitly gay friendly but open to everyone. On the other hand, more and more groups exclusively for lgbt people are appearing on Discord. Is it good or bad?
What are we all so afraid of?

There are many gay trans-men, that is, men who were born biologically female, now identify as male and are sexually attracted to men. Some use various medical interventions to make their bodies more male, such as hormone therapy or surgery, however many such men are anatomically female down below. Sorry for the slightly nsfw question, but as a cis-gender gay or bi man (with a penis), how do you feel about having vaginal sex with a trans-man?

You often hear people say that everyone has a right to their opinions. Is it true? Some opinions, like that the earth is flat or that the moon is made of cheese are wrong. Do people have a right to hold opinions that have been proven to be wrong?
Has any book or movie profoundly affected your life?

The Discord Community Guidelines prohibit the "sexualisation of minors (age 13-17) in any way." It has been suggested that a Discord group focussed on minority sexualities (such as this one) sexualises minors just by them being allowed to join. Given that young teenagers are sexual well before their 18th birthday, what does the term "sexualisation of minors" mean? Can a gay+ adult engage with a gay+ teen who has questions about sex and sexuality in a positive, constructive way or is any engagement at all online simply taboo?
Would you prefer homophobia to be classified as a hate crime or a mental illness?
How do you feel about being nude with others? What is it that makes you or people generally feel uncomfortable being nude? Would you feel more comfortable being nude with friends or with strangers?
What is the most generous gift you have ever received?
It has been said that religion gives people a moral compass and that people who are atheist or irreligious are therefor less moral. What do you think?
What is the reason for our existence?

The word "homosexual" first appeared in print in 1869 and then only became well known after 1886; a product of contemporary psychological theories of the subconscious mind. Oscar Wilde and his circle referred to themselves as "Uranians", men inhabited by female spirits. How then do we see the word "homosexual" printed in modern English translations of the Bible?
What is our greatest distraction?
Have you ever joined a protest march? Have you protested in some other way? What do you feel strongly enough about to protest?
How does being gay+ (gay, bisexual, pansexual or bi-curious) influence your meditation or yoga practice? Did it influence your decision to start?

Have you heard of "stealthing"? That is when two people agree to have sex using a condom but then the guy wearing the condom takes it off without his partner knowing. It is summarised as "non-consensual condom removal." Do you think it should be treated in the same way as rape?
Do you think meditation is good for health? What about mental health?
Where is the source of the strife and turmoil that characterizes humanity throughout our history?
Should everyone on the planet be striving toward a common goal? If so, what would that be?

A person joined this group but soon after left. He said "It's not my cup of tea tbh. Personally I see meditation as a very sacred religio-spiritual process to connect with my consciousness and pray to the most High. I don't think I would associate it with anything else. But the server was nice- it's just not how I view meditation." What do you think?

Do you think sexual positional preference (top or bottom) is an innate trait? Do the stereotypes around tops and bottoms (masculine vs feminine, dominant vs submissive, slim vs chubby etc.) have some basis in reality? What do you think of top and bottom as identities apart from sexual positional preference?

Henry Scott Tuke (1858-1929) was an English painter. He had no known relationships with women other than his sister. He was friends with Oscar Wilde and other "Uranians" and wrote poetry that idealised the love of Ancient Greece. Since the 1970's he has become " something of a cult figure in gay cultural circles" and Elton John has a large collection of his works (-for some reason-). There is however no direct evidence that he was gay and a small number of Tuke curators push back at any suggestion that he was or that his art is homoerotic.
What do you feel about “gay erasure” of historical figures? Is it important to oppose it or do gay people make too much fuss about it?
Do you think meditation improves your sex life? In what ways?
Is it possible to live a life of great joy in spite of our circumstances?
Do you use music, guided meditations, white noise or things like that to help you?
Do you think humans will last another 1,000 years?
How would you describe your father and his impact on your life?
Many famous teachers of Meditation, Yoga, Buddhism etc. have been found to be having sex with their students and it has caused a huge scandal. Should it matter?
I’ve heard of Tantric sex but I don’t know much about it. Is it mindful masturbation or sex? Edging? Sex without ejaculating? Having multiple orgasms? What exactly is it about?
What is your opinion about why religious faith is (or is not) important?
How does one obtain true peace?
When is war justifiable?
What’s the most sensible thing you’ve ever heard someone say?
test
Where do you find peace and replenishment when the world goes crazy?
It is said that mental illness is more common than the common cold. Why are so many people depressed or anxious?
What was your first contact with meditation? How old were you when you first meditated?
Where is the line between art and not art?
What historical person can you imagine yourself to be?
Why is there poverty and suffering in the world?
Do you have a regular meditation or yoga practice (same times every day)? What motivates you to practice?
What motivates you to practice yoga or meditation?
Under What circumstances would you adopt a child?

"Beliefs are a choice. If you find you are being discriminated against because of your beliefs, change them. The same can’t be said for race, gender, age and sexuality. It’s time to end the false equivalency." 
Do you agree? Is it ok to discriminate against a person because of their religious beliefs? On the other hand, is it rational to allow someone an exemption from the law on the basis of what they choose to believe?
Why is it that we always want more, not matter how much we have?
Do you practice yoga as a form of physical excercise, a spiritual practice or both? Is there a difference?

Do you practice meditation or yoga outdoors? Would you like to? What is your favourite place to practice or where would you most like to practice? Does the place where you practice make any difference?
What do you think about violence in computer games?
Do you think most people are on a spiritual journey?

“The customer rang and said that they’re coming in this afternoon to pick up their order. I thanked them for their patience.”
Using the pronouns they, their and them for a single person is common and correct English usage, usually when you don’t know their gender. Why is it then that when a person says that they’d prefer others to refer to them using those pronouns (they/their/them), some people object on the grounds that it doesn’t seem to be correct grammar to refer to a single person using them?
If you speak another language, what pronouns do you use for a person when you don’t know their gender?
What kind of teachers/rolemodels did you meet on your meditation journey and would you recommend them?
How do you feel about nude yoga or meditation? Do you or would you practice nude alone, with others or online on camera?
Do you believe in god or higher power? (Not necessarily the biblical or a religious version of it) How would you describe it and your relationship to it if it exists?
What is masculinity? Is it just a social construct or is it something more real?

A guy joined our group but left. He said "I don't really identify myself with naked meditations and a sexualization of things. I believe, and my brief experience shows me that, meditation is about your inner self, which has nothing to do with sex. It is beyond craving of the flesh.
and that's the main reason. Also, that was no real enquiry about our essence and things really deep you know." What do you think about this?

How do you feel when you see or hear about catastrophic events that don't directly affect you, like natural disasters, war, terrorist attacks, mass shootings etc. ? What do you do to cope with any intense feelings?
Do you think a person should be exempted from vaccination requirements on the basis of their religious beliefs?
Can you have wealth, status, fame and still be happy?
Do you perform any ritual before or after you practice meditation or yoga?
